function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reliance on non-contact interaction activities during the COVID-19 pandemic","Impact":"Dependency on non-contact activities may lead to reduced physical interaction and community engagement, impacting mental health and social well-being","Mitigation":"Promote hybrid interaction models that combine non-contact activities with safe physical engagement; prioritize mental health support and resources for isolated individuals","Technologies":"Virtual communication platforms, community engagement apps, mental health support apps","People":"Residents, especially those at risk of social isolation and mental health challenges","Owner":"Local community organizations, mental health professionals, urban planners"},{"Description":"Weakening of geographic distance due to technology","Impact":"Blurred boundaries of urban functions and enhanced land compatibility may lead to increased spread of contagious diseases and reduced effectiveness of spatial distancing measures","Mitigation":"Implement smart city technology to monitor and manage population density; integrate health surveillance systems with urban planning for disease containment","Technologies":"Smart city sensors, population density tracking software, health surveillance systems","People":"Urban residents, public health agencies","Owner":"City governments, urban planning authorities, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Reconfiguration of urban space due to technology","Impact":"Rapid reconfiguration of urban space may lead to inadequate infrastructure for disease containment and public health needs, increasing the risk of disease spread","Mitigation":"Utilize predictive modeling and scenario planning to anticipate urban space changes; prioritize flexible infrastructure design for health emergency response","Technologies":"Predictive modeling software, scenario planning tools, flexible infrastructure design concepts","People":"Urban residents, healthcare professionals","Owner":"Urban planning authorities, infrastructure development agencies, city governments"}]}
